explains: n. （形势的）不稳定；（行为、情绪等的）不稳定状态，变化无常

sentences.en: The election will take place against a backdrop of increasing instability.
sentences.cn: 选举的背景是逐渐不稳的局势。

sentences.en: Prices fluctuate, in response to harvests, natural disasters and political instability; and when they rise, it takes some time before new sources of supply become available.
sentences.cn: 价格会随着收成、自然灾害和政治不稳定而波动；当价格上涨时，需要一段时间才能找到新的供应来源。

sentences.en: Resentment against Germanic chieftains achieving high rank in the Roman military and factionalism among Roman leaders were among the causes of the period's considerable instability.
sentences.cn: 对于日耳曼部落首领在罗马军队中获得高地位的不满和罗马领导人之间的党派之争是该时期局势剧烈动荡的一部分原因。
